channel.title: Comments on: “Combobox” with multiple selections (Visual FoxPro)
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Theof
item.dc:creator: Theof
item.description:
I know it's been years since you wrote it.. Just found this, while doing a quick check if somebody had done such a control for mighty vfp.. before I tried to quickly do my own, and was suprised to find this.
I'll have a look at it. Thx!
item.content:encoded:
I know it’s been years since you wrote it..
Just found this, while doing a quick check if somebody had done such a control for mighty vfp.. before I tried to quickly do my own, and was suprised to find this.

I’ll have a look at it. Thx!

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Emerson Reed shows the code in his message in UT Re: Add image to a ListBox Thread #1552249 Message #1552256

Basically, you just set Picture property of the Listbox. He is saying it only works for him in the Paint method of the form, so if it will not work for you in the form’s Init method, try Paint method.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: I developed this class several years ago - I recommend to stick with the array as rowsourcetype. It may work with other types, but it may be a bit of work.
item.content:encoded: I developed this class several years ago – I recommend to stick with the array as rowsourcetype. It may work with other types, but it may be a bit of work.

item.title: By: hunting games

item.description: I've one drawback though. The images don't come up. - even the homepage has the photographs missing.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky

item.content:encoded:
VFP is Visual FoxPro for short. I probably should have specified it in full.

Thanks for your comment. I’ve changed the title now.
